title: How the west was lost: the story of the 1946 Aboriginal pastoral workers' strike
creator_credit: David Noakes, Heather Williams, Market Street Films and Friends Film Productions
brief_description: The story of the 1946 Aboriginal Pastoral Workers’ Strike. Eight hundred aboriginal station workers walked off sheep stations in the north west of Western Australia, marking the beginning of a strike which lasted more than three years. The strike was more than a demand for better wages and conditions, it was a struggle for basic human rights.
